title: The inverse function theorem
text: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).

title: Finding the Inverse of f(x) at $$a=0$$.
text: To find the inverse of f(x) where $$a=-3$$, then we need to first find what value of $$x$$ when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of $$-3$$. In this case, it is when $$x=1$$, so we know that f**-1(-3)=1.

title: Finding the derivative of f(f**(-1)(x)))
text: We found that the inverse of f(x) $$=1$$ in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what f'(1) equals, which is given to us, it is $$10$$.

title: Applying the Inverse Function Theorem
text: Since we know that $$\operatorname{f'}\left(1f^{\left(-1\right)}\right)$$ equals $$10$$, we can can apply the inverse function theorem by doing 1/(our answer). In this case this is $$\frac{1}{10}=\frac{1}{10}$$.
